alert.note: Alert for Briscoe (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 09 at 11:05PM CDT until June 10 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT FOR CHILDRESS...HALL AND EASTERN BRISCOE COUNTIES... At 1104 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles southwest of Dozier to 4 miles south of Memphis to 8 miles northeast of Caprock Canyon State Park, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...65 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...West Texas Mesonet. At 1056 PM CDT, the West Texas Mesonet near Turkey measured a wind gust of 64 mph. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Childress, Memphis, Turkey, Caprock Canyon State Park, Quitaque, Valley Schools, Tell, Kirkland, Brice, Estelline, Lakeview, and Plaska Community. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
